Interface CompanyInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Company

    public interface CompanyInterface
    Interface for the Employees class for CS103, Assignment 6, Spring 2014 Contains an ArrayList of objects that inherit from the Abstract class Employee Keeps track of the number of Mangers, Designers, Sales and Manufacturing employees Manages company employees Create a static variable to keep track of the number of company instances created
    Author:
    Professor Myers changed by Prof. Justh

    • Method Detail

      • addEmployee

        java.lang.String addEmployee(java.lang.String fname,
                           java.lang.String lname,
                           java.lang.String type,
                           double firstParam,
                           int secondParam,
                           int empNum)
        Add an employee to the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of employee: Manager, Design, Sales, Manufacturing
        fname - First Name
        lname - Last Name
        firstParam - Manager-salary, Design-hourly rate, Sales-weekly sales, Manufacturing-rate per piece
        secondParam - Manager-not needed (0), Design-number of hours, Sales-not needed (0), Manufacturing-number of pieces
        empNum - employee number
        Returns:
        null if successful add. Returns a string that describes the reason for not adding the employee. It will be one of the following:

        1. There is already a sales person\nEmployee not added

        2. There are already two design persons\nEmployee not added

        3. There are already four manufacturing persons \nEmployee not added

        4. There is already a manager\nEmployee not added

        5. There are already 8 employees\nEmployee not added

      • printCompany

        java.lang.String printCompany()
        Creates a string with the name of the company followed by the first and last name and position of each of the employees
        Returns:
        string Example:

        PigeonHawks

        John Smith Position: Manufacturing

        Bob Jones Position: Sales
